issue.title: [C++] Support optional arguments in aggregation function mapping in the Substrait consumer.
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-17534](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17534). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It appears that `sum` and `avg` have an optional enum argument to specify overflow behavior.  I'm not certain if I just missed this or if it is new.  Either way the current function mapping does not account for this.
